description: service_get_all_by() in nova.conductor.manager should list ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent the rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised. This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the client to handle.
title: nova.conductor.manager should list ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception

comments.content: service_get_all_by() in nova.conductor.manager should list ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent the rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised. This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the client to handle.

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/24322
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/24322
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/a8429a9bc943832c5b83fdeae004acc0fb832d37
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit a8429a9bc943832c5b83fdeae004acc0fb832d37
Author: Hans Lindgren <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Mar 13 14:48:45 2013 +0100

    List ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception
    
    service_get_all_by() in nova.conductor.manager should list
    ComputeHostNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent
    the rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised.
    This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the
    client to handle.
    
    Resolves bug 1154597.
    
    Change-Id: I656e264526673fa10e47692903a5f30f813b479b
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
